newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Bank Degroof raises Cockerill to hold.
newsitem.headline: Bank Degroof raises Cockerill to hold.

text.p: An expected earnings recovery in 1997 for Belgian steel maker Cockerill Sambre has led Belgian broker Bank Degroof to lift its recommendation on the stock from "sell" to "hold".

"The expected earnings recovery in 1997 will depend not only on the strength of the economic recovery in continental Europe but even more on the extent and speed with which steel prices revive," said Degroof analyst Bernard Hanssens in a research note.
"Given the uncertainty surrounding price developments during the coming months, we would not yet recommend buying, but nor would we any longer recommend selling," Hanssens said.
He said price falls look to be stemmed, with prices rising for products with long lead times, and order books pointing to higher capacity usage during the last months of 1996.
However, Hanssens said extremely low price levels meant second-half current earnings would be lower than in the first six months.
